snippet: In one of the most closely watched Senate races in the country, Barbara Boxer, the junior liberal Democratic Senator who won her first election in a hard-fought squeaker, won an even harder-fought race against her Republican challenger, State Trea...
lead_paragraph: In one of the most closely watched Senate races in the country, Barbara Boxer, the junior liberal Democratic Senator who won her first election in a hard-fought squeaker, won an even harder-fought race against her Republican challenger, State Treasurer Matt Fong. Even before the voting ended here at 8 P.M., early voter polls showed Ms. Boxer leading Mr. Fong by six to nine percentage points. Roy Behr, a spokesman for Ms. Boxer's campaign, said he expected the race to get closer when absentee ballots were counted.
abstract: Barbara Boxer, Democratic Senator from California, is re-elected; defeats Republican challenger, State Treasurer Matt Fong; photo (M)

headline.main: Barbara Boxer Wins Hard-Fought Race for Senate Seat in California
headline.kicker: THE 1998 ELECTIONS: THE NATION -- THE COMEBACK
